text: When a friend is upset, what's your first instinct?

answers.text: Listen, comfort, fix it, or give them space. Whatever they need.
Give advice confidently and tell them they've got this. It'll all blow over with time.
Make a joke, distract them, anything to lighten their mood and brighten their day a bit.

text: You find the last slice of pizza, what do you do?

answers.text: Take it confidently because you want it, you're hungry, you deserve it because you found it (duh).
Hide it. Take one bite and put it back. Or, forget about it and start making eggs (you got distracted).
Offer it to someone else - ask around who it belongs to!

text: Someone underestimates your abilities. How do you react?

answers.text: Forget about it, show off your skills, and let them see who's boss. They'll see it eventually.
Try to prove yourself gently without showing frustration. Actions speak louder than words. Be humble.
Do something unpredictable to surprise them. That'll show em;)

text: You see someone sitting alone at lunch.

answers.text: Sit with them. Duh??
Smile and be welcoming, but only if they approach first.
Make a joke to break the ice, nudge their shoulder, or lighten the mood.

text: You get into a heated discussion. How do you handle it?

answers.text: Crack a well-timed sarcastic comment to diffuse the tension! teehee
Stand your ground. Assert your needs. Make sure your point is heard.
Stay calm, listen, and avoid escalating the conflict. Breathe deeply. Make sure all sides are heard, that's important.

text: Your friends are planning a spontaneous adventure. You...

answers.text: make sure your have influence on where you go!
join and enjoy time with the group, offer to bring snacks.
stir the pot... what if we just left right now and played it by ear?

text: How do you react when someone gets credit for something you created?

answers.text: Feel a bit smug, jealous, or upset, but just own it next time. Move on. Stay in your own lane.
Congratulate them, be sincere, no hard feelings. All will even itself out in time, it's not worth it. Take the high road.
Playfully point it out, but maybe with a little bitter undertone. Ultimately it'll be okay, just sucks a little for now.

text: How do you usually show care for friends or family?

answers.text: Thoughtful gestures, checking in, listening, being intentional.
Encouragement, advice, backing them up, showing up.
Playful teasing, mischief, being on their timeline, making them laugh, bringing fun energy.

text: When it comes to style, fashion, presence...

answers.text: I am bold, confident, unapologetic, take some risks and own them.
I am comfortable, approachable, friendly.
I am quirky, fun, add some flair, sometimes different, slightly unpredictable.

text: You see a "do not touch" sign. What do you do?

answers.text: Probably touch, lol.
Probably don't touch (it's there for a reason).
Avoid, but consider if it's worth ignoring the sign?

text: When you meet someone new, your first instinct is to...

answers.text: Present your best self, first impressions count. Sus out the other person, show your confidence. Attract, don't chase.
Test the waters, tread with caution, make a joke or two, get to know people more over time.
Be kind, friendly, welcoming. Invite them to coffee (on me, ofc!) <3

text: A kid threw up nearby. You...

answers.text: Grab paper towels, help them clean up, find their mom probably (who's kid is this btw?)
Oof, rough day. Not my problem though... (again, who's kid is this?)
lol someone grab their dog to "clean it up" bahahahah it'd be funny tho

text: You have a free day. You...

answers.text: Finally! I can get my nails done, go to the gym, film some content, maybe schedule that date for the evening.
Thank god. Been needing a minute to catch up on emails, laundry, taking out the house trash, and call the rents.
Hear me out... what if we went skiing in Canada... I'm just saying... nahhhh I was just kidding (...unless... was I?)

text: We're at the pregame. You are...

answers.text: working the room. getting ready. occasional winks sent to cuties around the room, brushing past shoulders letting others know you're here
setting up drinks/snacks, making sure everyone eats enough, cleaning up the glass that just broke, holding someone's hair back
plotting devious moves for the night. texting your sneaky link in case nothing comes of the night. predicting who will be going off the handle most tn
haha wherever the wind blows (and the flights are cheapest)
Somewhere luxurious... I'm thinking a massage and a bellini by the sea sound nice
Somewhere that makes everyone in my party happy. Can we balance both adventure and fun, maybe squeeze in something educational or culture-focused?
